definition: see 吃閉門羹|吃闭门羹[chi1 bi4 men2 geng1]
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
soup
to be refused entrance (idiom)/to find the door closed
to close the door in one's face (idiom)

sentences.english: After the hospital refused several times, Guan decided to sue it.
sentences.chinese: 在医院吃了几次闭门羹之后，管礼明决定向法院起诉。

sentences.english: Mike's boss slammed the door on his request for a job transfer.
sentences.chinese: 麦可要求调任时，他的老板赏了他闭门羹。

sentences.english: Tom's boss slammed the door on his request for a job transfer.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆要求调任时，他的老板让他吃了闭门羹。

sentences.english: I intended to have a talk with him, but he gave me the cold shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 打算和他好好谈谈，却吃了个闭门羹。

sentences.english: I went to visit you yesterday but there's nobody home.
sentences.chinese: 我昨天去你们家玩，可是吃了闭门羹。

sentences.english: I went to see him yesterday, but unfortunately I was to a locked door.
sentences.chinese: 我昨天去他家看他，不想吃了闭门羹。

sentences.english: Did you say anything to him or just shut the door in his face?
sentences.chinese: 你跟他说什么了吗，还是直接给了他个闭门羹？

definition: to be refused entrance (idiom)/to find the door closed
lit. a soft nail/fig. a tactful retort or rejection
pent-up unspoken grievances/suffering not willingly or possibly spoken of
to meet with a rebuff
to visit sb at home
a cold reception/to cold-shoulder sb
to hit a wall/(fig.) to hit a brick wall/to hit a snag/to have the door slammed in one's face
over and over again (idiom)
to tactfully decline/to turn down gracefully
to rebuff/to refuse/to turn down
to lock one's door and refuse to see sb
lit. twice then three times (idiom); fig. repeatedly/over and over again
to learn from experience (coll.)
to return without any achievement (idiom); to go home with one's tail between one's legs
to go home (in a ceremonial procession)/to return home
lit. to rush at thin air/fig. to miss one's aim/to have nothing to show for one's troubles
